name: Hilton Grand Vacations Club at MarBrisa

reviews.text: MarBrisa is a wonderful hotel within walking distance to Legoland in Carlsbad. The hotel has it's own private entrance to the park, which was great. The phase two pool area was really nice. I wish that the poolside restaurant/bar was open but I was told that it would be open during the summer months. There was a great gas fireplace near the pool. Also, while the TV's were HD, none of the channels were HD. Channel selection was also a bit limited for the kids. This was not a big deal, but a bit surprising. I would definitely recommend MarBrisa to others.
reviews.title: Great hotel...great location!

reviews.text: The photos are gorgeous and description sounds lovely, but in reality the accommodations are about what we've come to expect from Hilton's Hampton Inn. That's fine for a Hampton Inn but we expect more from something that classifies itself as a resort. The new pool area is very nice, we especially enjoyed the multiple hot tubs and the large fire pit, but even there towel service was stingy (at a resort?) and the bar service was spotty.
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton standards, stretches definition of resort

reviews.text: There were bird droppings in front of our door and the steps leading to our floor all week, even though we mentioned it twice. The bathroom in our unit was only about an average clean and our microwave didn't work. The lobby was crowded and noisy when we checked in, noisy not from excited guests but from a very loud phone ringing the entire time we were being checked in. I travel frequently, always stay at Hilton properties and always receive more professional, more personal and less hurried welcomes.
reviews.title: local vacation

reviews.text: The location was easy on and off the highway and close to the charming Carlsbad, we didn't care about the Legoland and the noise didn't bother us. It would be convenient if that was your destination. The restaurant and grounds at the neighboring Sheraton resort were much more gracious and top notch.
reviews.title: As owners at MarBrisa, we love looking out of our living room window and seeing the Dragon ride and hearing the Legoland sounds

reviews.text: The fitness center is average, on the small side, and one of the two televisions didn't work the entire time we were there.
reviews.title: Room was not what my points showed it shold be
Timeshare
reviews.text: Phase II development appears to be moving along. You get the large swimming pools, the improved fitness center, and new Villa 68. Note that pool towels are found/kept in your room, and not at the pool area. Some guests are charged a resort fee (probably non-owners). The lobby is still located in Phase I, where we opted to stay to avoid seeing and hearing construction activity. This place seems to have an identity issue: am I staying in a Grand Pacific timeshare, a Hilton timeshare, or a Sheraton hotel? Nonetheless the suites are gorgeous, the staff is friendly, and the Carlsbad coast is beautiful. Happily, the wireless signal exceeded expectations. We'll be back.

I Love Marbrisa! I am a Hilton Vacation Club owner at this property and I know they are still at the works of completion but so far they are living up to the Hilton Vacation Club experience. The staff are great, always accomodating and smiling. The rooms are clean and well kept. I specially love their new pool and the fact that they have a small bar/resto with decent prices from the drinks to the food. Their pool is so big that I don't feel crowded by the other people enjoying the area. The only CONS I noted is the lack of washer/dryer in the units. Been to 2 other Hilton Clubs and I specially appreciate the washer units coz I have kids. They also need to put redbox type of DVD rentals that I enjoyed when I was in the Grand Waikikian in OAHU. Hopefully this will be in place soon so it can be a property that I can say is really thought out for the guest to enjoy!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Property!

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo on the 2nd floor. There were 3 of us, so it was nice and spacious. It was a very nice, clean condo, and well-equipped. The property itself was lovely - beautifully landscaped, lots of daily activities for kids, organized trips from the resort to various tourist attractions, 1 pool near the main lobby office bulding, and 2 pools with a cafe about a 5 minute walk downhill from the lobby building. Even though additional condos are being constructed surrounding the 2-pool area, it didn't distract from the beauty and relaxation. Music was playing and food & drink can be brought to your lounge chair. There are covered cabanas surrounding the pools with a pool table, foosball, and ping pong. There are also 2 hot tubs. Twenty/20 Restaurant and the Marketplace Cafe are in the Sheraton, but are on the same property and open to guests staying at Mar Brisa. We didn't eat a meal at Twenty/20, but did sit in the large, relaxing, outdoor area for a glass of wine on a few occasions.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.text: My only negative comments are related to noise (because I am a light sleeper). The condos are not very well insulated for noise. I could hear the man in the condo next door snoring at night, and the people above us had small children who started running back and forth starting at 5:30 am. Our windows faced Legoland and they start running the rollercoaster at approximately 6:00 am. Lesson learned for next time if it's possible to request a specific building or condo location.
reviews.title: Beautiful new pool Cove area

reviews.text: The Hilton Marbrisa 3 bedroom condo was perfect for 2 families to share. The kitchen was well equipped. The new Cove pool area has 2 pools, multiple spas, gym, bar, and outdoor games that my family enjoyed. Kids enjoyed playing foosball, pool, and ping pong poolside. We also liked relaxing with free drinks and snacks at the mini carnival. Thanks, Hilton!
reviews.title: AWESOME PLACE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no complaints of the staff or facilities. My 2 bedroom unit was spotless and I truly felt like I was home in terms of comfort. We even went to the Leucadia farmers market to shop for food to cook most of our meals for our short 3 night stay! For the above, I give 5 stars.
reviews.title: Wish I could say my stay was flawless...

reviews.text: The problem is with the sound insulation between units, particularly vertically. We were put on the bottom level, which was fine, until the family in the unit above us got home. Then the kids ran like a thundering herd of elephants, even past 10pm. That is when I could not tolerate it. The front desk was always kind and apologetic and promised the would call the guests to have them quiet their footsteps. If that did not work (which it did not), a second call to the front desk sent maintenance staff to knock on their door to make the request in person. That worked.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean and friendly staffs

reviews.text: I really am not a complainer and realize that yes, the family upstairs are on vacation as well, but I think that 10 pm would be a good time to wind your kids down. The problem is that the ground floor units require the guests to walk down a pretty big flight of stairs so maybe when they planned the room assignments, they felt it was less convenient for kids to get up and down those stairs? Just hope that management would be sensitive to this issue in the future, and my fellow travelers would be considerate of excessive noise-making.
reviews.title: Great stay at HGV Marbrisa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, location-wise, we loved the proximity of the resort to the highway and the ease of getting around. We fell in love with Carlsbad! So the next time we check in, we will just ask for a room on the top level!
reviews.title: Truly disappointed
Not impressed!
reviews.text: We own one week of timeshare at this property. This trip was our 3rd. stay at the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at this hotel bends over backwards to be friendly and helpful. We were even greeted by the maintenance people as if we were somebody special. When we departed one of the housekeepers brought us coffee as we waited for our taxi at the curb. When we needed change for soap for the laundry the front office GAVE us two boxes of soap....it was a great experience! us two boxes of soap.
reviews.title: Well trained staff

reviews.text: I stayed at MarBrisa As much as I would like to give them a 9 or 10 rating, I can not. I also voiced my opinion at the desk upon checkout. Below are some of the issues that occured in which I was less then pleased. * We had a family above us that had 3 children. The children DID NOT STOP running the entire 4 days of our stay. It sounded like our ceiling was going to cave in. It started early in the morning, in the late afternoons and even as late as midnight. I made over 4 phone calls to the front desk to please call that guest's room and ask them to please have them stop running. Im not sure if the room was called or not, because the kids never stopped running. We were constantly being woken up by the running. They would also run up and down the stairs, across the 2nd floor pathway and then back up stairs as well. After multiple phone calls to the front desk with nothing being down, I gave up. I was traveling with my 2 elderly parents in which this was supposed to be a relaxing getaway, instead we lost sleep and were annoyed. * Towels and trash. I had to call the front desk/guest services several times to have new towels brought to our room as well as have our trash throw out. When I called the second day of our stay, no one ever came to do that. I finally tracked down one of the housekeepers and asked that they come give us fresh towels and take away the trash. I had placed a call to the front desk as well as put the plaque requesting that service on my door. The 3rd day was the same thing. A call was made, no one came and then I finally got fresh towels from a housekeeper, but this time they did not take the dirty wet towels, they layed in a huge mound on the floors in both bathrooms and were still there when we checked out. We had 3 bags of trash sitting on the floor as well. Needless to say I was very displeased with the service at MarBrisa. As a Hilton Grand Vacation owner, this was not acceptable. I have had great stays in other facilities but MarBrisa was well under the standards Hilton provides.
reviews.title: So-So Accomadations

reviews.text: The facility seems fine. About 2 miles from the ocean. Helpful staff. Be aware that your stay at this facility will not accrue to your Hilton Honors account. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The proximity to the ocean is a real plus.
reviews.title: Hilton Marbrisa

reviews.text: not worth the money for a time share resort; it is split in 2, 1/2mile apart. Lobby closes at 9PM. After that its hard to get a hold of any one. It is close to Lego Land. Half an hour from San Diego. We had a much better experience at the Grand Pacific Resort, it has an adult children side. much better amenities; just as close to Lego Land
reviews.title: Marbrisa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third visit. Last time we were here we brought the kids and grandkids and it was perfect to be so close to Legoland.
reviews.title: Marbrisa Staff the Best!
